measured_by: dot-density perceptual confidence task / meta-d’/d’ (signal–detection metric)
justification: “We measured metacognition using a psychophysical task on which participants make repeated perceptual judgements and rated their confidence… we controlled for type 1 performance … by computing metacognitive efficiency (meta-d’/d’), which controls for type 1 sensitivity and metacognitive bias using the meta-d’ model.”

“We measured the same participants’ mentalizing ability on a separate task in which they watched short animations of abstract figures… Participants indicated their answer using multiple choice selection… Mentalizing ability was scored as the number of correctly identified mental states of each of the two triangles.”
“The following questionnaires were administered: (1) the Autism Quotient-10 (AQ-10) a brief assessment of autistic traits (a higher score indicates more autistic traits).”
“(2) the RAADS-14, a screening tool for autistic traits in adult populations… with a higher score indicating more autistic traits.”

“This analysis revealed that participants with self-reported difficulties in everyday types of social interaction, measured by the ‘mentalizing’ sub-scale of the RAADS-14, had lower metacognitive efficiency.”
“(3) the Beck Cognitive Insight Scale (BCIS) an assessment of people’s ability to distinguish between objective reality and subjective experience.”
